title: (inserted by section 28 of the Act of 2022) and section 79(2)(a) (inserted by
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Assisted Decision-Making
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Assisted Decision-Making 
(Capacity) Act 2015 (Prescribed Classes of Healthcare Professionals) 
Regulations 2023.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited assisted decision-making (capacity) act 2015 (prescribed class healthcare professionals) regulation 2023

title: (inserted by section 28 of the Act of 2022) and section 79(2)(a) (inserted by
heading: In these Regulations –
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations – 

“Act of 2005” means the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (No. 
27 of 2005); 

“Act of 2011” means the Nurses and Midwives Act 2011 (No. 41 of 2011); 

“immediate family member” means – 

(a) 

a spouse, civil partner, or cohabitant, 

(b) 

a child, son-in-law or daughter-in-law, 

(c) 

(d) 

(e) 

(f) 

a parent, step-parent, mother-in-law or father-in-law, 

a brother, sister, step-brother, step-sister, brother-in-law or 
sister-in-law, 

a grandparent or grandchild, 

an aunt or uncle, or 

(g) 

a nephew or niece; 

“Principal Act” means the Assisted Decision-Making (Capacity) Act 2015 (No. 
64 of 2015).
text_norm: 2 regulation - act 2005 mean health social care professional act 2005 (no 27 2005) act 2011 mean nurse midwife act 2011 (no 41 2011) immediate family member mean - (a) spouse civil partner cohabitant (b) child son-in-law daughter-in-law (c) (d) (e) (f) parent step-parent mother-in-law father-in-law brother sister step-brother step-sister brother-in-law sister-in-law grandparent grandchild aunt uncle (g) nephew niece principal act mean assisted decision-making (capacity) act 2015 (no 64 2015)

title: (inserted by section 28 of the Act of 2022) and section 79(2)(a) (inserted by
heading: 3. Subject
text_raw:
3. Subject 

to Regulation 4, 

the following classes of healthcare 
professionals are prescribed for the purposes of sections 21(4)(f), 26(3)(b), 
28(4)(c), 29(4)(b), 60(1)(c)(ii), 71A(2)(b)(ii) and 73A(2)(c)(ii) of the Principal 
Act: 

(a) 

occupational therapists, being persons whose names are for the 
time being entered in the register of members of the profession 
of occupational therapist established and maintained under 
section 36 of the Act of 2005; 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 2nd May, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [204] 3 

(b) 

(c) 

(d) 

(e) 

registered midwives within the meaning of section 2(1) of the 
Act of 2011; 

registered nurses within the meaning of section 2(1) of the Act 
of 2011; 

social workers, being persons whose names are for the time 
being entered in the register of members of the profession of 
social worker established and maintained under section 36 of the 
Act of 2005; 

speech and language therapists, being persons whose names are 
for the time being entered in the register of members of the 
profession of speech and language therapist established and 
maintained under section 36 of the Act of 2005.

title: (inserted by section 28 of the Act of 2022) and section 79(2)(a) (inserted by
heading: 4. A class to which Regulation 3 refers shall not include a person who
text_raw:
4. A class to which Regulation 3 refers shall not include a person who 
would otherwise be a member of that class but who is an immediate family 
member of a relevant person to whom a statement under section 21(4)(f), 
26(3)(b), 28(4)(c), 29(4)(b), 60(1)(c)(ii), 71A(2)(b)(ii) or 73A(2)(c)(ii) of the 
Principal Act would relate in a particular case. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

26 April, 2023. 

RODERIC O'GORMAN, 

Minister for Children, Equality, Disability, Integration and 
Youth. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [204]
